docs.title: Welcome to StayMate Documentation
docs.text: StayMate is a production-grade platform connecting tenants with landlords and compatible roommates. It leverages modern web technologies (Next.js, Spring Boot) and AI (Ollama) to create safe, verified, and compatible living arrangements.

docs.title: 🚀 Key Features
docs.text:
• Property Management: Landlords can list, manage, and track performance of properties.
  • Roommate Matching: AI-powered matching based on lifestyle, habits, and budget (95% compatibility target).
  • Secure Booking: Verified payments and booking requests.
  • Role-Based Dashboards: tailored experiences for Guests, Tenants, Landlords, and Admins.

docs.title: AI Architecture (Ollama Integration)
docs.text: The StayMate AI implementation focuses on privacy-first, local inference for analyzing roommate compatibility.

docs.title: 🧠 System Architecture
docs.text:
graph TD
    Client[Frontend] -->|Request Match| API[Backend API]
    API -->|1. Get Profiles| DB[(MySQL)]
    API -->|2. Construct Prompt| Service[AiMatchingService]
    Service -->|3. HTTP POST /api/generate| Ollama[Ollama Service]
    Ollama -->|4. Inference| Model[Llama 3.2]
    Model -->|5. JSON Output| Service
    Service -->|6. Save Score| DB
    Service -->|7. Return DTO| Client

docs.title: 🤖 The Model: Llama 3.2
docs.text: We selected Llama 3.2 for its balance of reasoning capability and lower resource footprint, making it ideal for local deployment.

docs.title: Why not OpenAI / Cloud LLMs?
docs.text:
1. Privacy: User lifestyle data (personally identifiable information) never leaves our infrastructure.
  2. Cost: Zero per-token cost; only fixed infrastructure cost.
  3. Latency: Local network calls are faster than round-trip API calls to US servers.

docs.title: 🛠 Prompt Engineering
docs.text: We use Few-Shot Prompting to ensure strict JSON output.

docs.title: System Prompt
docs.text: "You are an expert behavioral psychologist. Analyze the following two roommate profiles for compatibility. Output your analysis STRICTLY in the following JSON format..."

docs.title: Validation Layer
docs.text: To prevent "hallucinations" or broken JSON: 1. Strict Mode: We force JSON mode in Ollama where supported. 2. Schema Validation: The backend validates the response against a MatchResult DTO. 3. Retry Logic: If JSON parsing fails, we retry with a simpler prompt or fallback to rule-based scoring.

docs.title: 🔮 Future Scalability
docs.text: As user base grows, the AI layer can be scaled independently: - Horizontal Scaling: Deploy multiple Ollama containers behind a load balancer. - Quantization: Use 4-bit quantized models to reduce RAM usage by 50%.

docs.title: Backend Architecture
docs.text: StayMate's backend is a monolithic Spring Boot application designed with clean architecture principles, ready for microservices decomposition.

docs.title: 🏗 Layered Design
docs.text:
We follow a strict separation of concerns:

graph LR
    API[Controller Layer] --> Service[Service Layer]
    Service --> Repo[Repository Layer]
    Repo --> DB[(Database)]
    Service --> Mapper[MapStruct Mappers]

docs.title: 1. Controller Layer (web)
docs.text:
• Responsibility: Handle HTTP requests, validate input (@Valid), and return ResponseEntity.
  • Security: Annotated with @PreAuthorize for role-based access.
  • Example: RoommateController.java

docs.title: 2. Service Layer (service)
docs.text:
• Responsibility: Business logic, transactional boundaries (@Transactional).
  • Key Services:
    • RoommateService: Hybrid matching logic.
    • AiService: Integration with Ollama.
    • DashboardService: Complex data aggregation.

docs.title: 3. Repository Layer (repository)
docs.text:
• Responsibility: Data access via Spring Data JPA.
  • Features: Custom JPQL queries for complex filtering (e.g., searchPosts).

docs.title: 4. Domain Model (domain)
docs.text:
• Entities: JPA entities mapping to MySQL tables.
  • DTOs: Data Transfer Objects to decouple API contracts from database schema.

docs.title: 🛠 Key Technologies
docs.text:
• Spring Boot 3.2: Core framework.
  • Spring Security: JWT-based stateless auth.
  • Flyway: Database migration version control.
  • MinIO: S3-compatible object storage.
  • Lombok: Reduces boilerplate code.
  • MapStruct: Type-safe bean mapping.

docs.text: StayMate uses MySQL 8.0 as its primary relational database. The schema is designed for data integrity, scalability, and complex querying required for property searches and roommate matching.

docs.title: 1. Spatial Indexing
docs.text: Locations (Properties, Users) are stored using detailed lat/long coordinates. - Why?: Enables efficient "radius search" (e.g., Find properties within 5km of Gulshan). - Optimization: We use composite indexes on (latitude, longitude) for fast geospatial queries.

docs.title: 2. Soft Deletes
docs.text: Critical data is rarely hard-deleted. - Implementation: deleted_at timestamp column. - Benefit: detailed audit trails and data recovery for users.

docs.title: 3. JSON Columns
docs.text: Used for flexible attribute storage where schema rigidity isn't needed. - Examples: lifestyle_preferences in Roommate Profiles. - Trade-off: Slightly slower queries but easier iteration on matching logic.

docs.title: AI Roommate Matching
docs.text: StayMate uses a sophisticated Hybrid Matching Engine that combines deterministic rules with probabilistic AI scoring to find the compatible roommates.

docs.title: 🧠 Hybrid Logic Explained
docs.text: The matching process happens in two stages:

docs.title: Stage 1: Hard Filters (The "Must-Haves")
docs.text:
Before invoking the AI, the system filters out incompatible candidates to save resources and ensure basic compatibility.

  • Location: Must be within the target city/area (Fuzzy matching).
  • Budget: Budget ranges must overlap.
    • Logic: Candidate.max >= My.min AND Candidate.min <= My.max
  • Gender Preference: Must match strict gender requirements (if set).

docs.title: Stage 2: AI Scoring (The "Vibe Check")
docs.text:
Candidates passing Stage 1 are sent to the AI Engine (Ollama).

The AI evaluates soft factors: 1. Lifestyle: Smoking, Drinking, Pets, Guests. 2. Habits: Cleanliness Levels, Sleep Schedules. 3. Personality: Bio text analysis, Interests overlap.

docs.title: 📊 Match Score Algorithm
docs.text:
The final Compatibility Score (0-100) is a weighted aggregate:

Component Weight Source Core Essentials 40% Location & Budget overlap Lifestyle Habits 30% Smoking, Pets, Alcohol, Guests Daily Routine 30% Cleanliness, Sleep Schedule

Note: The AI also generates a qualitative summary (e.g., "You match well because you both are early risers and love pets") which is displayed on the frontend card.

docs.title: 🤖 Ollama Integration
docs.text: We use Llama 3 (via Ollama) running locally or on a dedicated inference server.

docs.title: Prompt Structure
docs.text:
The system constructs a structured prompt injecting two profiles:

You are an expert roommate matcher. Analyze these profiles:

Profile A (Me): ... [Structured Data] ...
Profile B (Candidate): ... [Structured Data] ...

Output JSON ONLY:
{
  "score": number (0-100),
  "strengths": ["string"],
  "concerns": ["string"],
  "summary": "1 sentence explanation..."
}

docs.title: Safety & Fallbacks
docs.text:
• JSON Enforcement: The prompt strictly requests JSON.
  • Fallback Logic: If AI fails or times out, the system falls back to a deterministic rule-based score (0-100) to ensure the UI never breaks.

docs.title: AI-Powered Roommate Matching
docs.text: Finding a compatible roommate is more than just budget and location. StayMate uses Ollama (Llama 3) to analyze personality traits and lifestyle habits.

docs.title: 1. The Match Profile
docs.text: Every tenant completes a lifestyle survey covering: - Sleep Schedule: Early bird vs. Night owl. - Cleanliness: Specialized standards. - Social Habits: Party animal vs. Introvert. - Guests & Pets: Policies on visitors and animals.

docs.title: 2. The AI Analysis
docs.text:
When a user views a potential roommate or a room listing, our AiService: 1. Checks for X-Simulation-Mode header (for load testing). 2. Retrieves both profiles from UserService. 3. Anonymizes the data (removes PII). 4. Sends a prompt to the local Ollama instance. 5. Receives a JSON compatibility score (0-100) and analysis.

sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Frontend
    participant Backend
    participant AiService
    participant Ollama

    User->>Frontend: View Matches
    Frontend->>Backend: GET /api/roommates/matches
    Backend->>Backend: Retrieve Candidate Profiles

    loop For Each Candidate
        Backend->>AiService: Calculate Compatibility

        alt Simulation Mode
            AiService-->>Backend: Return Mock Score (85%)
        else Real Mode
            AiService->>Ollama: POST /api/generate (Prompt)
            Ollama-->>AiService: JSON { score, analysis }
            AiService-->>Backend: Return AI Result
        end
    end

    Backend-->>Frontend: List<RoommatePostDTO>
    Frontend-->>User: Display Sorted Matches

docs.title: 3. The Match Score Implementation
docs.text: The RoommateService.java implementation uses a hybrid scoring system: 1. Hard Filters: Location & Budget (Must match). 2. Rule-Based Score: Java-based calculation for basics (Smoking, Pets). 3. AI Enrichment: Ollama provides the "Vibe Check" summary and nuanced compatibility insights.

docs.title: 4. Privacy First
docs.text:
We believe in privacy. The AI never sees: - Real Names - Contact Information - ID Documents

It only processes behavioral tags, ensuring unbiased and safe matching.

docs.title: Why We Built StayMate
docs.text:
Finding a place to live is stressful. Finding the right people to live with is even harder.

In today's urban housing market, renters face a "wild west" scenarios: - Scams: Fake listings and unverified landlords. - Incompatibility: Moving in with strangers often leads to lifestyle conflicts (cleanliness, noise, schedules). - Fragmentation: Using one app to find a flat, WhatsApp to chat, and spreadsheets to track bills.

StayMate was born from a simple idea:

What if finding a roommate was as intelligent and safe as a modern dating app, but for housing?

docs.title: The Vision
docs.text:
We envision a world where: - Safety is Default: Every user and property is verified. - Compatibility is Science: AI analyzes lifestyle habits to potential conflicts before they happen. - Transparency is Key: No hidden costs, no fake profiles.

StayMate isn't just about filling empty rooms; it's about creating homes where people thrive together.

docs.title: What is StayMate?
docs.text: StayMate is a modern rental and roommate matching platform designed to solve the trust and compatibility issues in the housing market. Unlike generic classifieds, StayMate focuses on verified profiles, structured data, and intelligent matching.

docs.title: 🎯 Core Mission
docs.text: To create safe, compatible, and transparent living arrangements for everyone.

docs.title: 🔑 Key Differentiators
docs.text:
1. Trust-First: ID verification and verified property listings.
  2. Smart Matching: We don't just match budgets; we match lifestyles (Sleep, Cleanliness, Habits).
  3. Landlord Tools: Professional dashboards for house owners to track income and occupancy.
  4. Modern UX: A fast, responsive Next.js application that feels like a native app.

docs.title: 👥 User Roles
docs.text:
• Tenant: Searches for rooms or roommates.
  • House Owner (Landlord): Lists properties, manages bookings.
  • Admin: Verifies users, moderates content.
  • Guest: Can browse but not book or view detailed profiles.

docs.title: 1. The Trust Deficit
docs.text: Renters rarely know who they are dealing with. - Landlords: Struggle to vet tenants efficiently. - Tenants: Fear deposit scams or dealing with unresponsive slumlords.

docs.title: 2. The mismatch of Lifestyles
docs.text: Most classified sites (Craigslist, Facebook Marketplace) focus on the property (Price, Location), completely ignoring the human element. - Result: Night owls paired with early risers. Neat freaks paired with messy roommates. - Consequence: High turnover, disputes, and stress.

docs.title: 3. Disconnected Workflows
docs.text: The rental journey is fragmented: 1. Search on Portal A 2. Chat on WhatsApp 3. Pay via Bank Transfer 4. Track expenses on Excel

docs.title: 4. Lack of Data for Owners
docs.text: Landlords operate in the dark, with little insight into: - Competitive pricing in their area. - Tenant demand trends. - Financial performance over time.

docs.title: How StayMate Solves This
docs.text: Problem StayMate Solution Lack of Trust Mandatory ID verification & Property validation. Lifestyle Clash AI-driven matching scores (0-100%) based on habits. Fragmented Tools All-in-one platform: Search, Chat, Pay, Track. Owner Blindness Advanced analytics dashboard for maximizing yield.

docs.title: Data Protection & Privacy
docs.text: StayMate is designed with Privacy by Design principles, ensuring user data is secure, anonymized where necessary, and deletable upon request (GDPR Compliance).

docs.title: 🛡 User Deletion Lifecycle
docs.text:
We implement a Soft Delete with Grace Period mechanism to prevent accidental data loss and ensure auditability.

stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> ACTIVE
    ACTIVE --> PENDING_DELETION: User/Admin Requests
    PENDING_DELETION --> ACTIVE: Cancel within 3 Days
    PENDING_DELETION --> DELETED: After 3 Days (Cron Job)

    state DELETED {
        [*] --> AnonymizeProfile
        AnonymizeProfile --> CancelFutureBookings
        CancelFutureBookings --> DeleteArtifacts
        DeleteArtifacts --> [*]
    }

docs.title: 1. Initiation (Grace Period)
docs.text:
• Action: User requests deletion via Settings or Admin triggers it.
  • Status: Account marked PENDING_DELETION.
  • Effect: Login disabled. Scheduled deletion date set (T+3 days).
  • Notification: Email sent with cancellation instructions.

docs.title: 2. Execution (The "Cascade")
docs.text:
After the grace period, the UserDeletionService executes a permanent cleanup:

Domain Action Detail Profile Anonymize Name -> "Deleted User", Email -> deleted_ID@..., PII removed. Bookings Cancel Future Future bookings cancelled & refunded. Past bookings kept for financial audit. Roommates Delete All roommate posts and requests removed. Notifications Delete All user notifications wiped. Properties Deactivate (Landlords only) All listings marked INACTIVE.

docs.title: PII Protection
docs.text:
• Passwords: Bcrypt hashed.
  • AI Processing: User data is anonymized before being sent to Ollama.
  • Role-Based Access: @PreAuthorize annotations ensure Tenants cannot access Landlord financial data.

docs.title: Audit Logs
docs.text: • Critical actions (Deletion, Payouts, verification) are logged to audit_logs table (immutable).

docs.title: Security Roles & Permissions
docs.text: StayMate uses Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) enforced by Spring Security.

docs.title: 🎭 User Roles
docs.text: Role Database Value Description Guest ROLE_GUEST Unauthenticated users. Can search but not view details. Tenant ROLE_USER Standard user seeking rentals. Can book and message. Landlord ROLE_HOUSE_OWNER Property owner. Can list properties and view earnings. Admin ROLE_ADMIN Platform administrator. Can ban users and verify IDs.

docs.title: 🔐 Implementation Details
docs.text:
• Annotations: We use @PreAuthorize("hasRole('ADMIN')") on Controllers.
  • Database: Roles are stored in the roles table and linked via user_roles.
  • JWT Claims: The roles claim in the Access Token determines access.

docs.title: 🛡 Protected Resources
docs.text:
• Admin Only:
    • /api/admin/**
    • /api/users/ban/**
    • /api/properties/verify/**
  • Landlord Only:
    • /api/properties (POST/PUT/DELETE)
    • /api/dashboard/landlord
  • Authenticated:
    • /api/users/me
    • /api/bookings

CREATE DATABASE staymate;

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

Schema Management

Schema is auto-managed by Flyway migrations. No manual schema setup required.

docker run -d \

  -e MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD=minioadmin \
  -p 9005:9000 \
  -p 9006:9001 \
